benchmark_details.name: MizanQA
benchmark_details.overview: MizanQA is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs on Moroccan legal question answering (QA) tasks, characterised by rich linguistic and legal complexity. It comprises over 1,700 multiple-choice questions that capture the nuances of authentic legal reasoning.
similar_benchmarks: Hijazi et al. (2024) Arabic legal benchmark

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of existing large language models (LLMs) in answering legal questions within the Moroccan legal framework.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset does not comprehensively represent Moroccan law, especially in uncodified areas and recent legislative updates.

data.source: Extracted from publicly available Moroccan law MCQ banks and exams.
data.annotation: Manually verified by legal experts and annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the machine's ability to select correct options for questions with multiple correct answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better understanding and accuracy of legal concepts in the Moroccan context.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline model evaluations included various multilingual and Arabic-centric LLMs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes demographic breakdowns provided by proficient annotators.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to minimize bias in legal AI applications.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All QA pairs were manually verified for accuracy and relevance, with attention to minimizing bias.
